page.title: 12FARMING
page.content:
Much of the farmland around Kineton is cultivated by{Forsythe Farmwork {Limited.}This large concern grows wheat and oil seed rape. Existing hedges are retained, ten metre gaps being left to facilitate modern machinery, and positive steps taken to encourage wild life by planting areas of cover around natural ponds. A national award for{conservation}was won in 1984.
Among the smaller farms production is more varied. On Red House Farm cattle and sheep graze pasture that have never seen chemicals or pesticides. Kineton Grange Farm produces sheep and Windmill Farm's Friesian Herd has its milk transported to London. Pittern Hill Farm produces beef cattle and Brooklands is a mixed arable and sheep farm.
